text \<open>Use as simp rule. To show $a-b=0$, it suffices to show $a=b$.\<close>

lemma (in abelian_group) minus_other_side [simp]:
  "\<lbrakk>a\<in>carrier G; b\<in>carrier G\<rbrakk> \<Longrightarrow> (a\<ominus>\<^bsub>G\<^esub>b = \<zero>\<^bsub>G\<^esub>) = (a=b)"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<lbrakk>a \<in> carrier G; b \<in> carrier G\<rbrakk>
    \<Longrightarrow> (a \<ominus> b = \<zero>) = (a = b)
by (metis a_minus_def add.inv_closed add.m_comm r_neg r_neg2)
text \<open>Define the units group $R^{\times}$ and show it is actually a group.\<close>

definition units_group::"('a,'b) ring_scheme \<Rightarrow> 'a monoid"
  where "units_group R = \<lparr>carrier = Units R, mult = (\<lambda>x y. x\<otimes>\<^bsub>R\<^esub> y), one = \<one>\<^bsub>R\<^esub>\<rparr>"

proof (prove)
goal (5 subgoals):
 1. \<And>x y.
       \<lbrakk>x \<in> carrier (units_group R);
        y \<in> carrier (units_group R)\<rbrakk>
       \<Longrightarrow> x \<otimes>\<^bsub>units_group R\<^esub> y
                         \<in> carrier (units_group R)
 2. \<one>\<^bsub>units_group R\<^esub> \<in> carrier (units_group R)
 3. \<And>x y z.
       \<lbrakk>x \<in> carrier (units_group R);
        y \<in> carrier (units_group R);
        z \<in> carrier (units_group R)\<rbrakk>
       \<Longrightarrow> x \<otimes>\<^bsub>units_group R\<^esub>
                         y \<otimes>\<^bsub>units_group R\<^esub>
                         z =
                         x \<otimes>\<^bsub>units_group R\<^esub>
                         (y \<otimes>\<^bsub>units_group R\<^esub> z)
 4. \<And>x.
       x \<in> carrier (units_group R) \<Longrightarrow>
       \<one>\<^bsub>units_group R\<^esub> \<otimes>\<^bsub>units_group R\<^esub>
       x =
       x
 5. \<And>x.
       x \<in> carrier (units_group R) \<Longrightarrow>
       \<exists>y\<in>carrier (units_group R).
          y \<otimes>\<^bsub>units_group R\<^esub> x =
          \<one>\<^bsub>units_group R\<^esub>

proof (prove)
goal (2 subgoals):
 1. \<And>x y z.
       \<lbrakk>x \<in> Units R; y \<in> Units R; z \<in> Units R\<rbrakk>
       \<Longrightarrow> x \<otimes> y \<otimes> z =
                         x \<otimes> (y \<otimes> z)
 2. \<And>x.
       x \<in> Units R \<Longrightarrow>
       \<exists>y\<in>Units R. y \<otimes> x = \<one>

proof (prove)

       \<lbrakk>x \<in> Units R; y \<in> Units R; z \<in> Units R\<rbrakk>
       \<Longrightarrow> y \<in> carrier R
 3. \<And>x y z.
       \<lbrakk>x \<in> Units R; y \<in> Units R; z \<in> Units R\<rbrakk>
       \<Longrightarrow> z \<in> carrier R
 4. \<And>x.
       x \<in> Units R \<Longrightarrow>
